page.title: 18THE RIDGEWAY - A GIPSY TRACK
page.content: In years gone by,{gipsies}were a familiar sight along the Fosse Way and would often set up camp on the {Ridgeway}(known locally as Green Lane) south of Hunningham. As many as 4 or 5{caravans}would be drawn up on the narrow grass verges, complete with wood fires, dogs, (usually whippets or lurchers) and sometimes even a few bantam chickens. Washing would be laid out to dry on the hedgerows. The smallish but sturdy horses were almost always piebald or skewbald and often two to a caravan. {Since those days the gipsies have {declined in number but as recently as {1983 a gipsy family camped near the {Long Itchington Road, complete with {painted caravan and piebald pony.
